column3: ## Submitting an update
Go to the My journals tab on the Publisher dashboard

column4: You see a list of journals, each with a button "Update"

column3: Click the "Update" button next to one of your journals

column4: a new browser tab opens, titled "Journal update request form for ..."

column3: Attempt to edit the Journal title, Alternative title, ISSN (print), ISSN (online)

column4: You cannot

column3: Make some changes to the editable questions (make a note of what those changes are)
Click on 'Review your answers' in the section stepper on the right and submit the form

column4: The form is submitted successfully and you are taken to the 'My update requests' tab
A flash message tells you that your update has been submitted. Another flash message says that a confirmation email has been sent.

column3: clear the flash messages
Click on the "My journals" tab

column4: The journal you submitted an update for now says "View update" by it

column3: Go back to the "My Update Requests" tab

column4: The journal for which you submitted an update is listed here

column3: Click "Edit" on the update request you created above

column4: You can see the edit form for the update request
Your changes implemented above are present

column3: Make another change to the form and submit

column4: Your changes are submitted successfully.

column3: Click "Delete"

column4: A pop-up appears asking you if you are sure you want to delete the update request.

column3: click 'No'
Click 'Delete' and 'Yes, delete it'

column4: You are shown a message 'Your application has been deleted'

column3: Click the link to take you back to the dashboard and click on 'My update requests'

column4: The update request no longer appears on this tab

column3: create a new update request for one of your journals and submit it
Open a new session in a different browser or a private (incognito) window
Log in as an administrator and go to the dashboard
Go to the Update Requests Search page

column4: The update request you submitted above is visible

column3: Click "Review Update"

column4: A new browser tab opens with the update request form
The top of the form contains a table showing the difference between the journal and the update request
The changes in the difference table match the changes you made when submitting the update request

column3: Click on one of the links in the left column of the difference table

column4: You are scrolled down to the corresponding change and the change is highlighted in black under the question

column3: Go back to the top of the form and change the status to "In Progress" and save.  Do not make any other changes at this point
Go back to the other browser window, where you are signed in as a publisher
Go to the Publisher's Update Requests tab
Go back to the browser window where you are logged in as admin
Edit the update request, and change the status to "Revisions Required"

column4: flash notification confirms that the publisher has been alerted

column3: Go back to the other browser window, where you are signed in as a publisher
Go to the 'My update requests' tab. You may need to reload the page.

column4: Your update request is editable again and the black button now says 'Edit'

column3: Make an edit to the update request
Go back to the browser window where you are logged in as admin
Edit the update request, and Reject it
Go back to the My update requests tab in the other browser window, where you are signed in as a publisher

column4: The status of the update requests has changed to 'Application rejected'.
